snippet: The Department of Agriculture estimated that 14 billion bushels of corn will be produced this year, but late planting may reduce the harvest.
abstract: Department of Agriculture predicts record corn and soybean yields in 2013, despite intense spring showers that have delayed planting, damaged crops already in the ground and prevented farmers from sowing all their seeds; projections are base on estimates made before heavy rains came about how many acres of crops will be planted.
lead_paragraph: The Department of Agriculture estimated that 14 billion bushels of corn will be produced this year, but late planting may reduce the harvest.

headline.main: Record Corn and Soybean Yields Are Predicted
headline.print_headline: Record Corn and Soybean Yields Predicted, but Late Planting May Cut Harvest
